title: ponies: disallow float assignment after integer constant division
body:
Go is really good about no implicit conversions, but it's still possible to bite
yourself if you aren't careful. It would be great if this were disallowed. Obviously not
fixable before go2.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
http://play.golang.org/p/VXR_fZ20Qr

What is the expected output?
Compile error, floating point assignment after integer division. 

What do you see instead?
Performs integer division and then assigns the value to a float64. Not likely the
desired result.
